intro: Hiraea simsiana, commonly known as the Cape hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Hiraea simsiana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats.
